functions.name: addColumn

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: colIndex
params.description: The index (0-based) at which to insert the new column. If omitted, the column is appended to the end

params.name: col
params.description: A Python list containing the new column data. Length must match the dataset row count

params.name: colName
params.description: The name for the new column

params.name: colType
params.description: The data type of the column (e.g., str, int, float, java.util.Date)

returns.description: A new dataset with the added column

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with a new column added or inserted.
examples:
columnData = [i * 10 for i in range(ds.getRowCount())]
newDs = system.dataset.addColumn(ds, columnData, 'Score', int)

functions.name: addRow

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The index (0-based) at which to insert the new row. Throws IndexError if out of range. If omitted, the row is appended

params.name: row
params.description: A Python list representing the new row data. Length must equal the number of columns

returns.description: A new dataset with the added row

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with a new row added or inserted.

functions.name: addRows

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The index (0-based) at which to insert the new rows. If omitted, the rows are appended

params.name: rows
params.description: A list of lists, where each inner list is a row. Each row length must equal the number of columns

returns.description: A new dataset with the added rows

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with multiple new rows added or inserted.

functions.name: appendDataset

params.name: dataset1
params.description: The first dataset. The returned dataset will have the same columns as this dataset

params.name: dataset2
params.description: The second dataset. Its rows will be appended to the first dataset. Column count must match

returns.description: A new dataset with all rows from both datasets combined

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with the second dataset's rows appended to the first.
functions.long_description: Combines two datasets by appending all rows from the second to the first. The column structure is taken from the first dataset. Both datasets must have the same number of columns.

functions.name: clearDataset

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to clear

returns.description: A new dataset with the same column names and types but no rows

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with the same columns but all rows removed.

functions.name: dataSetToHTML

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, the HTML table will include a header row

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to format as HTML

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the HTML page

returns.description: A string containing an HTML page with the dataset in a table

functions.description: Formats the contents of a dataset as an HTML page and returns the result as a string.

functions.name: deleteRow

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The index (0-based) of the row to delete

returns.description: A new dataset with the specified row removed

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with a single row removed.

functions.name: deleteRows

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndices
params.description: A list of row indices (0-based) to delete

returns.description: A new dataset with the specified rows removed

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with one or more rows removed.

functions.name: exportCSV

params.name: filename
params.description: A suggested filename for the CSV file

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, the CSV file will include a header row

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to export

params.name: forceQualifiedPath
params.description: If True, the filename must be an absolute path

returns.description: The path to the saved file

functions.description: Exports the contents of a dataset as a CSV file, prompting the user to save.

functions.name: exportExcel

params.name: filename
params.description: A suggested filename for the Excel file

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, the spreadsheet will include a header row

params.name: dataset
params.description: A sequence of one or more datasets, one for each sheet in the workbook

params.name: nullsEmpty
params.description: If True, cells with NULL values are left empty instead of showing a default

returns.description: The path to the saved file

functions.description: Exports the contents of a dataset as an Excel spreadsheet, prompting the user to save.

functions.name: exportHTML

params.name: filename
params.description: A suggested filename for the HTML file

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, the HTML table will include a header row

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to export

params.name: title
params.description: The title for the HTML page

returns.description: The path to the saved file

functions.description: Exports the contents of a dataset to an HTML page, prompting the user to save.

functions.name: filterColumns

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset to filter

params.name: columns
params.description: A list of column indices (0-based) or column names to retain. Column order in the result matches this list

returns.description: A new dataset containing only the specified columns

functions.description: Returns a new dataset containing only the specified columns.

functions.name: formatDates

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset containing Date columns

params.name: dateFormat
params.description: A date format pattern (e.g., 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')

params.name: locale
params.description: A locale string (e.g., 'en_US'). If omitted, uses the default locale

returns.description: A new dataset where Date columns are replaced with formatted String columns

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with Date columns converted to formatted strings.

functions.name: fromCSV

params.name: csv
params.description: A string holding a CSV dataset in the Ignition CSV format (#NAMES, #TYPES, #ROWS headers followed by data)

returns.description: A new dataset created from the CSV string

functions.description: Converts a dataset stored in Ignition's CSV format string to a Dataset.
functions.long_description: Parses a CSV string in Ignition's special format into a Dataset. The CSV must include #NAMES (column names), #TYPES (type aliases like i, str, d, f, b, date), and #ROWS headers. This is the inverse of system.dataset.toCSV().

functions.name: getColumnHeaders

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to get headers from

returns.description: A Python list of column header names

functions.description: Returns the column headers of a dataset as a Python list.

functions.name: setValue

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row index (0-based) of the cell to modify

params.name: colIndex
params.description: The column index (0-based) or column name of the cell to modify

params.name: value
params.description: The new value for the cell

returns.description: A new dataset with the specified cell value changed

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with one cell value changed.
functions.long_description: Creates a new dataset with a single cell value altered. Since datasets are immutable, calling this in a loop creates many intermediate datasets. For bulk modifications, convert to PyDataSet or Python lists first, modify, then convert back with toDataSet().

functions.name: sort

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to sort

params.name: keyColumn
params.description: The column index (0-based) or column name to sort by

params.name: ascending
params.description: If True, sorts in ascending order. If False, descending

params.name: naturalOrdering
params.description: If True, uses natural ordering where contiguous numbers are treated as a single number (e.g., a2 before a11)

returns.description: A new sorted dataset

functions.description: Sorts a dataset by a specified column and returns the sorted result.

functions.name: toCSV

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to format as CSV

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, includes column headers in the CSV output

params.name: forExport
params.description: If True, uses Ignition's special CSV format with #NAMES, #TYPES, and #ROWS headers compatible with fromCSV()

params.name: localized
params.description: If True, formats numbers and dates according to the client's locale

returns.description: A string containing the dataset in CSV format

functions.description: Formats the contents of a dataset as a CSV string.
examples:
# Export format compatible with fromCSV()
csv = system.dataset.toCSV(ds, forExport=True)

functions.name: toDataSet

params.name: headers
params.description: Either a list of column name strings for creating a new dataset, or a PyDataset to convert

params.name: data
params.description: A list of rows for the new dataset. Each row must match the headers length. Not used when converting a PyDataset

returns.description: A new Dataset object

functions.description: Creates a new Dataset from column headers and row data, or converts a PyDataset to a Dataset.
functions.long_description: Has two overloads: (1) Pass a PyDataset to convert it to a standard Dataset. (2) Pass a list of header strings and a list of row lists to create a new Dataset from scratch. This is the standard way to create datasets programmatically in Ignition scripts.
examples:
# Convert PyDataset back to Dataset
pyDs = system.db.runQuery('SELECT * FROM table1')
ds = system.dataset.toDataSet(pyDs)

functions.name: toExcel

params.name: showHeaders
params.description: If True, the spreadsheet will include a header row

params.name: dataset
params.description: A list of one or more datasets, one for each sheet in the workbook

params.name: nullsEmpty
params.description: If True, cells with NULL values are left empty instead of showing a default

params.name: sheetNames
params.description: A list of sheet names, one per dataset. Must match the number of datasets

returns.description: A byte array representing an Excel workbook

functions.description: Formats one or more datasets as an Excel spreadsheet and returns the result as a byte array.
examples:
# Multiple sheets
excel = system.dataset.toExcel(True, [sheet1, sheet2], sheetNames=['Sales', 'Inventory'])

functions.name: toPyDataSet

params.name: dataset
params.description: The dataset to convert

returns.description: A PyDataset wrapper providing Pythonic iteration and indexing over the dataset

functions.description: Converts a Dataset to a PyDataset for more Pythonic access (iteration, indexing).
functions.long_description: Wraps a standard Dataset in a PyDataset object that supports Python-style iteration and dictionary-style column access (e.g., row['ColumnName']). More convenient for scripting than the raw Java Dataset interface. Use toDataSet() to convert back when needed.

functions.name: updateRow

params.name: dataset
params.description: The starting dataset. Datasets are immutable so a new dataset is returned

params.name: rowIndex
params.description: The row index (0-based) of the row to update

params.name: changes
params.description: A dictionary mapping column names to new values for the specified row

returns.description: A new dataset with the specified row updated

functions.description: Returns a new dataset with one row altered based on the provided column-value mappings.
